Text.Value: You overestimate your abilities. I stand with Raphael.
If I die, Baldur's Gate is doomed.
Let me leave. There doesn't need to be any more bloodshed.
Say nothing.
You.
How tiresome. Am I to understand that you wish to die with them?

EditorData.NodeContext: addressed to orthon, who has just turned on him - impatient and petulant rather than rage

Text.Value: In my world - in my HOUSE - there is order, and there are rules. You have broken the most important rule of all, and committed the cardinal sin.
Few have bested me once. None have bested me twice. I stand with Raphael.
I wish to fight with them.
SISTER OH SISTER I'VE WEPT AND I'VE CRIED, BUT ALL WOULD BE WELL IF YOU WERE BY MY SIDE
You've given me no other choice. I offered you liberty, and you've chosen death.
Fight with me, Yurgir, or I'll strike you down again.
If you kill me, you'll never get the Crown.
I met these insects once before, beneath the shadowlands. I did not expect to see them again.
These insects understand the honour of hunters better than you ever will, trickster.
They will make fine prey.
I still hold your contract, and your presence here is a violation of Clause Fifteen, Subclause Four.
These insects struck me down beneath the shadowlands. They are worthy opponents.
Afraid to fight me alone, Raphael?
That's twice as long as Haarlep said it takes to finish you.
Wait - please. I have one final proposition.
This isn't a rebellion, it's a revolt. I'M REVOLTING.
I AM NOT ENTIRELY SURE THAT HE WON'T
Ha. I believe you would.
Korrilla - this is your chance to be free. Help me take him down.
Wrong. I might have to wait another hundred years - maybe a thousand - but my time will come. Your time is over, little mouse.
I will not abide it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Aura of flames surround him for a moment as his rage simmers up

Text.Value: If you have any last words, make it quick. It will only take a moment to finish you.
Now... down comes the claw.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Raphael transforms into his devil form,towering ower the players who react in horror

Text.Value: You would have been heroes if you'd only dealt fairly with me. Instead, you're not so different to doomed Karsus, over-reaching your limits, and burning your world to ash.
Let's finish this.
Oh, Hope, you are such a piteous thing. All it takes is a crumb from the table, and you forget the centuries of starvation. This insolence has earned you centuries more.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: speaking to Hope, across the room

Text.Value: Your house is in disarray - the guards couldn't stop me from freeing Hope.
Instead, you came here and risked everything.
It's the fatal flaw of mortalkind. Take away their free will, and they call you a tyrant. Allow them to indulge it, and they become tyrants.
Their skulls will make fine trophies.
And Hope already burned.
These insects tricked me beneath the shadowlands.
Commander - you can salvage a trophy from these insects when I'm done with them.
Join the winning side - Raphael doesn't stand a chance against me.
Hope. It always burns you in the end, little mouse.
I permitted you the freedom to decide your own fate. You could have been smart, selfless - saved the world.
And I'll sup on your soul.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Raphel summons flames that consume the players

Text.Value: I didn't need to. It was very entertaining watching you dig your own grave.
And that's why I helped them find your home.
They helped me to eliminate my prey beneath the shadowlands. Prey that you hoped I would never find.
I'll make a necklace of their cunning tongues.
You did what? I will make you suffer torments so vile, the hells themselves will shudder to see them.

EditorData.NodeContext: quietly threatening, with heavy emphasis on 'what'

Text.Value: The only reason you're here is because Raphael allowed you to be.
You mistake efficiency and strategy for cowardice. It will be your last mistake.
It is said that hope is a fine breakfast, but a poor supper. Well, the shadows grow long, and the hour is late. It's suppertime.
You came here uninvited, and you stole from me.
As do I, little mouse. Your flesh, my supper. Your blood, my wine. Your soul, my plaything.
WRONG WRONG WRONG. They will save their world and smash you to smithereens.
To stand against a devil in his own home. That takes courage. I'm with you.
My name is Yurgir.
You need better staff - Korrilla didn't even try to stop me.
No words? No matter. You will scream before the end, little mouse.
Then Hope dies today.
You contemptuous creature!
It's all the same in the end.
And whatever torments I invent for Yurgir, I will perfect in the centuries I spend toying with your soul.

EditorData.NodeContext: addressed to player, emphasis on 'your' as he's just switched his attention from an NPC to the player

Text.Value: It's this charming naivety that makes your company such a joy to me, Hope. I'll even forgive this little rebellion once you're suitably chastised.
Gladly.
I cannot lose to you. Not here. Not in my home. I cannot die!
You went against your word, and defied our contract.
And whether it takes a hundred years or a thousand, the Crown will be mine eventually. My time will come. Your time is over, little mouse.
It's over, Raphael. You can't stop me.
In my world - in my HOUSE - there is order, and there is decorum.
Mephistopheles, hear your son! I am at your mercy - save me!
I've been hoping to kill you ever since I met you.
There are many things in your world that I loathe. Litters of kittens, chattering children - the noise and the chaos of it all.
In doing so, you brought the chaos of your world into mine.
You think I'm on your side?
But your intrusion and insolence is not the most disappointing part of this whole affair. Your stupidity is.
Such a shame. I'll make sure you live long enough to watch it burn.
Korrilla - tell our unwelcome guest about your role in their tragic downfall.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: turning to address Korrilla, close by his side

Text.Value: *Time slows for a moment, and the air becomes thicker. The master of the house is coming.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Players react to an initially unseen presence with trepidation - they can sense a change in the air, and feel as if they are being watched. Then smoke materialises and when it clears, Raphael is in the room. Politely threatening.

Synopsis: Dialogue with Raphael in House of Hope, when players try to escape it after an alarm goes off
